UPES DEHRADUN 
Assignment-3, 23 OCT 2025 
 
Semester                : III 
Course Name        : Material Science                                                               
Course Code         : MEMA2005                                                                             Max. Marks: 100 
 
Topic: Mechanical Property Measurement 
Total Marks: 100 
Instructions: 
• Answer all questions from Sections A and B, and any Three questions from Section 
C. 
• Use neat sketches, labelled diagrams, and correct units wherever necessary. 
• Support your answers with appropriate equations and examples. 
• Clarity, accuracy, and presentation will be given weightage. 
 
Section A – Short Answer Questions (5 × 4 = 20 Marks) 
(Answer any five in brief, 50–70 words each) 
1. Define fracture and distinguish between ductile and brittle fracture. 
2. What is the role of dislocations in ductile fracture? 
3. Explain the term “Griffith crack” and its significance. 
4. Define fatigue life and endurance limit. 
5. What is the purpose of an impact test? Name two commonly used impact testing 
methods. 
6. Differentiate between intergranular and transgranular fracture. 
7. What are the advantages of Nondestructive Testing (NDT) over destructive testing? 
 
Section B – Descriptive/Analytical Questions (5 × 08 = 40 Marks) 
(Answer any five questions) 
1. (a) Explain the mechanism of ductile fracture in metals with neat sketches showing the 
stages of fracture. 
(b) Discuss the appearance of fracture surfaces under SEM for ductile fracture.  
(08 Marks) 
2. Derive Griffith’s theory of brittle fracture and explain the relation between stress, crack 
length, and surface energy. (08 Marks) 
3. Compare and contrast intergranular and transgranular fracture modes with 
microstructural examples and engineering relevance. (08 Marks) 
4. Explain the S–N curve for fatigue testing. How does mean stress affect fatigue life? 
Illustrate with an example. (08 Marks) 
5. Describe the working principle and significance of Charpy and Izod impact tests . 
Compare their specimen geometry, notch type, and test setup. (08 Marks)

6. What are the common causes of fatigue failure in engineering components? Discuss 
methods to improve fatigue resistance. (08 Marks) 
 
Section C – Applied / Problem-Based Questions (2 × 20 = 40 Marks) 
(Answer any two questions) 
1. Case Study: A turbine blade exhibits failure after 500 hours of operation. 
o Describe the steps to determine whether the failure was due to fatigue or brittle 
fracture. 
o Suggest appropriate Nondestructive Testing (NDT)  methods to detect early -
stage cracks in similar components. (20 Marks) 
2. (a) Discuss in detail various Nondestructive Testing techniques  such as Ultrasonic 
Testing, Radiography, Magnetic Particle Inspection, and Dye Penetrant Testing with 
their working principles and applications. 
(b) Compare their suitability for detecting surface vs. subsurface cracks. (20 Marks) 
 
• Submit your handwritten or typed assignment in PDF format. 
• Include your Name, Roll Number, and Section on every page. 
• Deadline for submission: 13 NOVEMBER 2025. 
• Late submission will attract a penalty of 10% of the total marks.
